items.title: Dancing Astronaut’s New Music Friday: Maesic, Boris Brejcha, Dimension, and more (October 31, 2025)
items.description: New music highlights from Dancing Astronaut’s Artists to Watch in 2025 Shimza, AR/CO and Kasango – Fire Fire (Maesic Remix) Dancing Astronaut Artist to Watch in 2025 Maesic lends his take on Shimza, AR/CO and Kasango’s “Fire Fire.” Maesic continues a red hot release year after his hit single “Life Is Simple (Move Your Body)” took the... Read More ▸
items.fullContent:
New music highlights from Dancing Astronaut’s Artists to Watch in 2025

Shimza, AR/CO and Kasango – Fire Fire (Maesic Remix)

Dancing Astronaut Artist to Watch in 2025 Maesic lends his take on Shimza, AR/CO and Kasango’s “Fire Fire.” Maesic continues a red hot release year after his hit single “Life Is Simple (Move Your Body)” took the scene by storm. He’s fresh off of a Los Angeles stint that saw him play a sold-out show at Exchange LA as well as a surprise B2B with Artist to Watch alum Alex Wann. – Zach Salafia

Dimension – Guardian Angel (feat. Karen Harding)

After months of fans pleading for its release, Dimension finally unveils his long-awaited single “Guardian Angel,” featuring songwriter Karen Harding. A standout moment in his recent sets, the track fuses Harding’s powerful vocals with Dimension’s signature drum & bass sound. Carried by both raw emotion and high momentum, “Guardian Angel” is a reflection on faith, redemption, and resilience. – Liana Stern

Boris Brejcha – Red in the Desert

Boris Brejcha returns with another dose of high-tech minimal perfection. Out now on his own label, Fckng Serious, “Red in the Desert” channels the German producer’s unmistakable energy. With vocals from Poppy Baskcomb, the track delivers a mesmerizing blend of emotion and atmosphere. Arriving just a month after his last single, “Fennek,” Brejcha keeps his creative momentum in full throttle, pairing the release with a new music video that brings his desert-inspired vision to life. Another reminder that no one does high-tech minimal quite like Boris. – Danielle Carty

Featured image: Maesic

The post Dancing Astronaut’s New Music Friday: Maesic, Boris Brejcha, Dimension, and more (October 31, 2025) appeared first on Dancing Astronaut.

items.title: deadmau5 Is Back: New Single “Ameonna,” New Album, New Red Rocks Show
items.description: It’s official — deadmau5 is back. The world-renowned electronic producer has announced his first full-length studio album in nearly a decade. This is massive news for the newcomers and the seasoned dance music goers. The album is set for release in 2026. Kicking off this long-awaited new era, he drops “Ameonna”, a lush, cinematic instrumental […] T
items.fullContent:
It’s official — deadmau5 is back. The world-renowned electronic producer has announced his first full-length studio album in nearly a decade. This is massive news for the newcomers and the seasoned dance music goers. The album is set for release in 2026. Kicking off this long-awaited new era, he drops “Ameonna”, a lush, cinematic instrumental out today via his mau5trap label.

Building from shimmering atmospherics to an electrified storm of synths, “Ameonna” evokes the raw precision and texture that made deadmau5 a household name with tracks like “Faxing Berlin” and “Some Chords.” It’s both nostalgic and forward-looking — a sonic bridge between his legacy and his next chapter.

But that’s not all. deadmau5 is officially retiring his iconic Cube production and debuting an entirely new live show this November 7 & 8 at Red Rocks Amphitheatre in Colorado. The five-hour set will feature his techno alter-ego testpilot, new music from the upcoming album, and even a mau5 drum & bass segment to close out the night — all wrapped in cutting-edge visuals and fresh stage design.

To celebrate, Denver will host a two-day mau5hop pop-up at 95 S Cherokee Street, open from 5 a.m. to 7 p.m. Fans can grab exclusive merch, including hoodies, vinyl, hats, and even a limited Atari x deadmau5 “Meowingtons’ Revenge” playable cartridge. deadmau5 himself will be there for meet-and-greets each day from noon to 3 p.m. Entry is free and open to all ages.

With “Ameonna,” a new album on the horizon, and a fresh live experience about to debut, deadmau5 isn’t just returning — he’s reinventing.

deadmau5 – Ameonna |

deadmau5 · Ameonna

items.title: A New Era Has Begun As Day Of The deadmau5 Makes History At Red Rocks
items.description: Saturday, November 8th at Red Rocks will live rent free in the minds of the 10,000 fans who attended the new era of deadmau5. Joel Zimmerman, better known by his electronic dance music moniker, deadmau5, delivered a five-hour sonic journey that reminded everyone why he’s one of electronic music’s most inventive minds. From blistering techno […] The
items.fullContent:
Saturday, November 8th at Red Rocks will live rent free in the minds of the 10,000 fans who attended the new era of deadmau5. Joel Zimmerman, better known by his electronic dance music moniker, deadmau5, delivered a five-hour sonic journey that reminded everyone why he’s one of electronic music’s most inventive minds. From blistering techno as Testpilot to high-energy drum & bass as DnB Mau5, every moment felt intentional, immersive, and alive.

Before the show, we stopped by the mau5shop pop-up just south of the Denver City Center. The line for the meet and greet was massive, so we skipped that part and waited in the merch line instead — and it was *so worth it.* Hidden behind what looked like a laundry room was a secret passageway leading into the merch area, where a giant Meowingtons blow-up greeted fans. The two “Day of the Dead” mau5 helmets were on display, and seeing them up close was unreal. There was no shortcuts taken in the fabrication of these helmets.

The merch itself was next-level. Compared to the Red Rocks booth, this pop-up had far better selections and exclusives. I grabbed the deadmau5 letterman jacket, while my friend picked up a hoodie and shirt. The designs were clean, bold, and collector-worthy — a reminder not to miss the next pop-up event.

Back at Red Rocks, the night kicked off right on schedule.

Testpilot wasted no time tearing up the decks from 6:00 to 7:30. Joel came out in a hat instead of the helmet, locked in from the first beat. The set was dark, mechanical, and full of drive. Figure humanoids appeared on stage throughout, adding to the otherworldly vibe as the sun dipped behind the rocks.

At 7:30, DEATHPIXIE took over — the first virtual artist ever signed to a major dance label. Her set was visually stunning and full of energy, especially with the addition of three live dancers. They gave the production a human element that helped bridge the digital and real worlds. It was unlike anything I’d seen at a mau5trap show before.

Then, from 8:00 to 10:20, it was time for the main event. Deadmau5 returned to the stage, transitioning seamlessly from Testpilot’s grit to his signature cinematic sound. He dropped a brand-new unreleased track — easily one of the best of the night — and while I was hoping for “Monophobia,” it’s hard to complain with a catalog this deep. “Strobe” was a crowd favorite as always, and his collab with Kaskade, “Escape,” sent the entire amphitheater into pure chaos.

Skylar Grey made a surprise appearance midway through, dressed in all red and completely owning the stage. Her live vocals on “My Heart Has Teeth” and “Let You Lie” with DEATHPIXIE gave the night a haunting, powerful touch.

By the time the DnB Mau5 set started around 10:20, the energy was off the charts. It didn’t lean into the muddy UK grime style — instead, it kept that clean, polished deadmau5 texture. The transitions were flawless, the basslines sharp. You could tell Joel was in complete flow state. Around an hour and a half into the main set, something shifted — he stopped performing *at* the music and started performing *through* it.

As the final track faded and lights dimmed, Joel grabbed the mic and said this was one of his top 10 sets ever. And I believe it. The crowd, the visuals, the sound — everything clicked in a way that felt timeless.

It was an honor to photograph this show and capture a night that was pure artistry in motion. Huge thanks to Alex Greenberg and the entire deadmau5 team for the hospitality. This one will be hard to top.
